Name: Erdbeerkuchen
Description: A German strawberry pie consisting of strawberries and sometimes whipped cream

Name: Knackwurst
Description: A sausage type of northern German origin from the mid-16th century . The manifold available varieties depend on the geographical region of their production

Name: Hamburger Speck
Description: A type of candy made out of foamed sugar with various coatings . The colors of the candy are often the same as the colors of Hamburg 's flag ( red and white ) , with a white central square and two red outer squares

Name: Labskaus
Description: A dish made from corned beef , herring , mashed potatoes , and beetroot , served with a fried egg and a pickled cucumber . See also under Bremen and Lower Saxony

Name: Marmorkuchen
Description: A cake with a streaked or mottled appearance ( like marble ) achieved by very lightly blending light and dark batter

Name: Birnen , Bohnen und Speck
Description: A dish composed of pears , beans , and bacon , invariably accompanied by potatoes

Name: Hamburger Aalsuppe [ de ]
Description: A sweet and sour soup of eel , meat broth , dried fruits , vegetables , and herbs

Name: Franzbrötchen
Description: A pastry made from Phyllo dough , covered with sugar and powdered cinnamon that is usually eaten for breakfast . It literally means Frenchman 's roll and is only rarely found outside of Hamburg , Germany

Name: Frikadelle
Description: A type of flat meatball composed of pork , beef and onions commonly eaten with pasta salad , potatoes or simply in a bread roll with mustard or other condiments

Name: Hamburger Hummersuppe
Description: A creamy lobster soup served with a small amount of whipped cream and garnished with dill

Name: Hamburger Krabbensuppe
Description: A creamy shrimp soup served with a small amount of whipped cream and garnished with dill

Name: Heißewecken [ de ]
Description: A traditional pastry that has been proven in German-speaking since the late Middle Ages and was eaten in north and northwest Germany before the beginning of the pre-Easter Lent , especially from Rose Monday to Ash Wednesday

Name: Krabbentoast
Description: A bread dish that is made with vegetables and shrimp

Name: Rote Grütze
Description: A jelly/jam-like dessert or summer dish made from berries especially currants that can be eaten pure , but is often accompanied by milk or vanilla sauce
